TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 901-902
TEI.2.document_title: Andrew Scott to Stephen F Austin, 12-11-1832

barker_notes.barker_summary: Andrew Scott to Austin, Scotia, Ark., December 11, 1832. Introducing James W. Robinson.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 901-902

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Andrew Scott to Austin, Scotia, Ark., December 11, 1832. Introducing James W. Robinson.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Scotia, Pope County Arks Territory*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="12-11-1832">Decr. 11th 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dr Sir, My friend and *person_mentioned*neighbor */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Col. James W. Robinson*/person_mentioned*, will hand you this, I had hoped for some time past to have the pleasure of presenting him to you in person, but unforeseen circumstances has prevented this,— I shall however be with you between this and *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1833">March next*/date_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Robinson*/person_mentioned* is a *person_mentioned*practitioner of law*/person_mentioned* in our *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, in which profession he is well grounded, but *location_mentioned*Arkansas */location_mentioned*at present holds out but few inducements to the *location_mentioned*lawyer*/location_mentioned*, for previous to the entrance of *person_mentioned*Col. Robinson*/person_mentioned* there were supernumerary numbers of that profession, he therefore visits your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*with a view of making it his future *location_mentioned*residence */location_mentioned*should it hold out to him sufficient inducements, he leaves in my *location_mentioned*neighborhood */location_mentioned*his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*and one *person_mentioned*child*/person_mentioned*, for whom he will speedily return should he meet with flattering encouragement in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*— Anything you may do to advance *person_mentioned*Col. Robinsons*/person_mentioned* interests, or promote his comfort, you will find him worthy of—and be assured it will afford to your old friend much gratification—*person_mentioned*Mrs. Scott*/person_mentioned* Joins me in respects to yourself and your *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Andrew Scott*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
